chapter.title: Children of Noah
chapter.subtitle: בני נח - Bnei Noach
chapter.para: Bnei Noach are the children of Noah. haShem Elokenim commanded all bnei Noach to keep the sheva mitzvot bnei Noach. The rainbow is a sign of that covenant. It's an eternal covenant. As long as a society keeps to the covenant, haShem Elokim will not destroy that society.

All of humanity are technically bnei Noach. Bnei Yisrael has a distinction from the merit of Avraham and are not classified as bnei Noach even though technically they are also descended from Noah.
Nedarim 31a

Therefore, whenever the term bnei Noach is used, this is referring those that are not bnei Yisrael. I currently do not know if gerim are bnei Noach. Gerim are attached to bnei Yisrael and are described as being part of klal Yisrael. It appears to me that gerim would then also be from the merit of Avraham and set apart with with bnei Yisrael.
